author: Simon Rimmer
method: For the croquettes, cook the Puy lentils according to packet instructions. Drain. Mix the Puy lentils, sweet potato, mixed herbs, breadcrumbs, nutmeg and egg yolk together in a bowl until well combined.   For the coating, sprinkle the flour onto a plate, beat the eggs in a bowl and sprinkle the polenta onto a separate plate. With floured hands, mould small amounts of the mixture into 7.5cm/3in long cylinders. Dredge the croquettes in the flour, then dip into the beaten egg and finally dip into the polenta to coat completely. Heat the oil in a deep heavy-based frying pan until a breadcrumb sizzles and turns brown when dropped into it. (CAUTION: hot oil can be dangerous. Do not leave unattended.) Fry the croquettes for 2-3 minutes, or until crisp and golden-brown. Remove from the pan with a slotted spoon and set aside to drain on kitchen paper. For the raita, mix the yoghurt, mint and lime zest and juice together in a bowl.  Serve the croquettes with the raita dip alongside.
ingredients: 75g/2¾oz Puy lentils ,  100g/3½oz cooked, mashed sweet potato,  1 tbsp dried mixed herbs,  25g/1oz breadcrumbs,  1 tsp grated nutmeg,  1 free-range egg yolk,  100g/3½oz plain flour, plus extra for dusting,  1 free-range egg, beaten,  150g/5½oz polenta,  vegetable oil, for frying,  200g/7oz yoghurt,  1 tbsp chopped fresh mint,  1 lime, juice and zest
